article.title: Pictures from Brueghel
article.p:
Pictures from Brueghel
, in full
Pictures from Brueghel, and Other Poems
, collection of poetry by
William Carlos Williams
, published in 1962 and awarded a
Pulitzer Prize
in 1963. In this volume Williams transcends the
objectivist
style of his earlier work, treating poetry as a medium for ideas as well as a means of depicting the physical world. Williams also explored new verse forms in the collection. Wanting to find a rhythm suited to American speech, he experimented with a version of
free verse
he termed
versos sueltos
(“loose verses”), which makes use of the triadic stanza and a variable foot measure.
